bibl.title: Wiley v. Keokuk. Syllabus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Albert Wiley v Kiskick. } Error from Douglas County Affirmed

1 A person who had served as a talesman in the trial of a cause at the same term of the court was placed on the regular panel in place of a prior excused. He was challenged by defendant because of his habing used som previous service as talesman. The court reminded the challenge, and he was then challenged peremptorily held. That the court used in overling the challengers, but in as much as the record does not show that the defendant exhausted his peremptory challenges a new trial will not be adued for reversed for an ever which was caused by the action of the defendant.
2) It is not ever to change that an illegal act has been committed by the defendant, when the answer of defendant admits facts that show he did certain acts which must be held illegal

3 It's not ever to change the jury that they are authorized to give exemplary damages where the elements of fraud, malice, gross negligence, or oppression mingle in and form pact of the cause of action.
